diagram_descriptions: Turquoise background with white decorative lace border at top and bottom
Martha Stewart Crafts logo in circular seal at top center
Large white text reading 'CRAFT ESSENTIALS' centered on page
Subtitle: 'MUST-HAVE TOOLS AND INSPIRING IDEAS'
Row of 7 essential craft tools illustrated in white/grayscale: paint container, pencil, screwdriver, clipboard clamp, scissors, brush, and craft knife
Lower section features book cover image for 'Martha Stewart's Encyclopedia of Crafts' with photo of Martha Stewart in white clothing

tools_reference.name: Punches
tools_reference.use: Play with positive and negative punch possibilities in more than 60 different shapes for cards, gift tags, or stencils.
tools_reference.visual_description: Six white hand punch tools with various shape dies shown in a row

tools_reference.name: Edge Punches
tools_reference.use: Choose from 13 different designs to add a decorative border pattern to cards, scrapbook pages, place settings, and other paper crafts.
tools_reference.visual_description: Two white edge punch tools with decorative border pattern dies shown

tools_reference.name: Circle Cutter
tools_reference.use: Plot perfect circles from 1in to 5 7/8 in in diameter with the use of the handy guide marks.
tools_reference.visual_description: White circular cutting tool with central handle and guide mark dial

tools_reference.name: Paper Trimmer
tools_reference.use: Score or cut straight edges from both directions—perfect for right- or left-handed crafters.

tools_reference.name: Screw Punch
tools_reference.use: Punch various-sized holes in craftstock, foam, fabric, and leather.
tools_reference.visual_description: Single hand punch tool with screw adjustment mechanism

tools_reference.name: Bone Folder
tools_reference.use: Score and burnish perfect folds or use to apply rub-on transfers.
tools_reference.visual_description: Pointed bone/plastic folding tool with handle

tools_reference.name: Craft Knife
tools_reference.use: Cut or crop a variety of materials.
tools_reference.visual_description: Precision craft knife with pointed blade and handle

tools_reference.name: 14 x 3in Ruler
tools_reference.use: Clear, no-slip surface with printed guides for easy and accurate measuring
tools_reference.visual_description: Green ruler with grid pattern and measurement markings

tools_reference.name: 12 x 12in Cutting Mat
tools_reference.use: Sturdy and self-healing to prolong the life of your cutting implements.
tools_reference.visual_description: Dark gray square cutting mat with grid pattern

tools_reference.name: Precision Scissors
tools_reference.use: Blade tension screw adjusts for both heavy and light jobs.
tools_reference.visual_description: Metal scissors with loop handles and tension adjustment mechanism

tools_reference.name: Glitters
tools_reference.use: With 40 sparkling colors to choose from, these finely cut, blended glitters make cards, ornaments, flowers, and pictures shimmer and shine.
tools_reference.visual_description: Array of 12 small glass jars containing colored glitter in various hues including green, blue, copper, red, and pink

diagram_descriptions: Six white hand punch tools with various shaped dies (ladybug, heart, flower, butterfly, elephant, snowflake) arranged in a row
Two white edge punch tools with decorative border pattern dies
Single white circular cutting tool with central handle and measurement guides
White paper trimmer with measurement markings and handles for bidirectional cutting
Single hand punch tool with screw adjustment feature
Pointed bone folder tool with handle
Precision craft knife with pointed blade
Green ruler with grid pattern measuring 14 x 3in
Dark gray square self-healing cutting mat with grid pattern measuring 12 x 12in
Metal precision scissors with adjustable tension mechanism
Array of 12 glass jars with 40 different sparkling glitter colors

projects.name: Punched Ribbon Card

steps.instruction: Using a ruler and bone folder, score a crease down the length of a 5 x 5in piece of craftstock to create the card fold. Cut out a craftstock background and punch around edges if desired, before gluing to card front.
steps.visual_description: Photo showing ruler, bone folder, craftstock pieces, and scoring process

steps.instruction: With screw punch, create holes in the shape of a heart as shown. Weave ribbon in and out of holes to form a perfect heart. Tie ends in the front or back, as desired.
steps.visual_description: Photo showing screw punch creating heart-shaped holes and ribbon being woven through holes

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Fold card in half vertically along score line. Glue background piece to card front. Punch holes in heart shape and weave ribbon through holes.

tips: Use the screw punch and your imagination to create many different types of card themes to fit any occasion
Stars, flowers, and geometric shapes are just the beginning of the possibilities
projects.finished_product_description: A folded greeting card with red punched heart design and woven ribbon accents. Background features pink polka dot pattern. Card has decorative red borders and ribbon bow details.

projects.name: Glittered Birds

materials.color: gold, and various colors as desired

tools.name: paintbrush
tools.purpose: applying craft glue to bird surfaces

steps.instruction: Using a paintbrush and craft glue, coat the tail of a plastic bird and sprinkle spoonfuls of glitter on top. Let glue dry before shaking off the excess glitter.
steps.visual_description: Photo showing plastic birds on glittered branches with varying glitter colors and densities

steps.instruction: Repeat, using the same or different colors of glitter on the wings, body, and head.
steps.visual_description: Photo showing multiple glittered birds in different colors (green, blue, brown, red) positioned on branches

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Arrange glittered birds on glittered branch in natural perching positions

projects.finished_product_description: Decorative display of plastic birds with gold and colored glitter coating, perched on a glittered branch. Multiple birds in different colors (green, blue, brown, red) create a festive, sparkly arrangement.

tools_reference.name: Ruler
tools_reference.use: Measuring and guiding precise score lines

tools_reference.name: Bone Folder
tools_reference.use: Scoring and burnishing folds to create sharp creases

tools_reference.name: Screw Punch
tools_reference.use: Creating decorative holes in various shapes including hearts, stars, and geometric patterns

tools_reference.name: Paintbrush
tools_reference.use: Applying craft glue to surfaces for glitter application

diagram_descriptions: Photo of Punched Ribbon Card showing completed greeting card with red heart outline and woven red ribbon on pink polka dot background
Photo of Punched Ribbon Card showing ruler, bone folder, and craftstock pieces laid out
Photo of Punched Ribbon Card showing screw punch creating heart-shaped holes and ribbon being woven through
Photo of Glittered Birds showing multiple plastic birds in various colors (green, blue, brown, red) perched on glittered branches, all coated with gold and colored glitter

projects.name: Flower Bouquet Card

steps.instruction: Trim a piece of card stock to 7 x 10in. Using a bone folder, score and crease to create card fold. Add a decorative border with the flourish edge punch.

Punch flower shapes out of pretty complementary colors of craftstock using the hydrangea, rose leaf, cosmos, daisy, and frond punches. Cut stem shapes out of paper with a craft knife. Arrange the bouquet on card front, and affix with glue or double-sided tape. Embellish with a bow of ribbon.

tips: Try other great punches to create adorable cards and invitations for the winter holiday season, summer weddings, and for birthdays and parties all year long
projects.finished_product_description: A greeting card with a folded format featuring a bouquet of punched flowers with green stems and a ribbon bow embellishment. The card has a decorative edge border. Displayed with white envelope, sample cards with flower designs, and loose punched flower and leaf shapes.
visual_elements: Main card with orange and pink punched flowers arranged in a bouquet with green stems and pink ribbon bow
White card stock envelope with decorative border
Sample blue card with flower arrangement pattern
Scattered punched flower and leaf shapes in yellow and green
White vase-shaped containers with white flowers and brushes

projects.name: Kid's Party Ideas

steps.instruction: Napkin holders: cut 6in squares of bandanna craftstock into triangles and trim off one corner. Wrap around napkins and affix with double-sided tape.

Party hats: cut 12in squares of bandanna craftstock into circles, then halve. Roll from one corner to form cone, and seal edge with double-sided tape. On each side, string baker's twine through screw-punched holes and knot the ends. For tassels, cut fringe in a 2 x 3in piece of tissue paper. Roll up and insert into tip of hat; tape at bottom to secure.

Stamp number onto craftstock and punch around with starburst punch. Using circle cutter, make slightly bigger circles out of craftstock of a contrasting color. Use foam dot to affix punched shape to the circle. Adhere to party hats using foam dots, or tape to toothpicks.

projects.finished_product_description: A party setup featuring decorated cone-shaped party hats in green, pink, and white with numbered circular decorations (numbered 5), matching napkin holders, cupcakes on a tiered stand, and tissue paper wrapped candies or treat holders with orange bows.
visual_elements: Party hats in cone shape (green, pink, white, blue) with numbered circles (marked '5') and baker's twine ties with tissue paper tassels
Napkin holders wrapped in patterned bandanna craftstock
Tiered cupcake stand with frosted cupcakes
Tissue paper wrapped treat holders with fringe and orange ribbon bows
Close-up detail showing starburst-punched circles, numbered stamps, and assembly components
Hand holding a completed cone-shaped party hat with orange and patterned design
Reference materials showing punched circles, screw punch, starburst punch, and crafting components

tools_reference.name: Bone Folder
tools_reference.use: Score and crease card stock for clean folds

tools_reference.name: Flourish Edge Punch
tools_reference.use: Create decorative borders on card edges

tools_reference.name: Craft Knife
tools_reference.use: Cut stem shapes and other details

tools_reference.name: Starburst Punch
tools_reference.use: Punch decorative starburst shapes around stamped numbers

projects.name: Summer Party Banner and Napkin Holder

materials.quantity: two strands for garland, one strand for card

tools.name: scissors or craft knife
tools.purpose: cut craftstock into banner shapes and letters

steps.instruction: Banner: cut craftstock into 6 x 8in banner shapes. Cut letters from craftstock using computer-printed letters as a template, and adhere to banners. Punch holes near top corners and thread two strands of baker's twine through to create garland. Create a mini garland for a card invitation using stamped letters and one strand of baker's twine. Punch small holes near the top corners of the card and thread ends of garland through holes, tying at back.
steps.visual_description: Colorful banner with letters P, A, R, T suspended from a striped background with rolled napkins and yellow drink pitcher below

steps.instruction: Napkin holder: cut a strip of paper according to template below. Wrap strip around napkin and interlock slits, securing with double-sided tape if necessary.
steps.visual_description: Rolled napkins in pink, teal, and yellow colors tied with yellow band; hands demonstrating interlocking slits

tips: Use computer-printed letters as template for cutting
Thread baker's twine through punched holes for hanging
Use double-sided tape to secure napkin holder slits if necessary
projects.finished_product_description: Festive summer party banner with colorful letters and matching napkin holders with intertwined slits

projects.name: Baby Gift Book

materials.item: blue dot paper from Baby Boy Multimedia Pad

materials.quantity: 3 pieces for frames, 1 piece for front cover border

tools.name: paper trimmer
tools.purpose: cut blue dot paper to specified dimensions

tools.name: scallop punch
tools.purpose: punch scallop dot edge along long sides

tools.name: screw punch
tools.purpose: punch holes along left edge for binding

steps.instruction: With paper trimmer, cut two pieces of blue dot paper from the Baby Boy Multimedia Pad to 5 1/2 x 6 3/8in. Punch scallop dot edge along the long side of each. Back with blue craftstock.
Leaving a 5/8in binding space, adhere a preprinted frame from multimedia pad to the fronts and backs of three pieces of 4 3/4 x 6 3/8in blue craftstock.

Punch scallop dot edge on right border of a 3 3/4 x 4in piece of blue craftstock, and adhere to front cover. Adhere a 2 3/4 x 3 3/4in piece of multi dot paper on top, then add a blue felt appliqué elephant sticker to the center.
Use screw punch along left edge of each page. Thread yellow seam binding through holes and tie into a bow to finish.
steps.visual_description: Completed baby gift book showing front cover with elephant sticker, pages with scallop-punched edges, and yellow ribbon binding

tips: Use screw punch for clean, evenly-spaced holes
Thread yellow seam binding through all punched holes
Tie binding into a bow for decorative finish
projects.finished_product_description: A decorative baby gift book with scallop-punched edges, preprinted frames on interior pages, elephant appliqué on front cover, and yellow seam binding closure

templates.name: Napkin Ring Holder Template
templates.shape_description: Rectangular strip with two interlocking vertical slits positioned to create an interlock mechanism when wrapped around napkin

pen_tips_reference.use: Variable line width and painting effects

Row B shows permanent marker creating thin curved lines
Row C shows Arts & Crafts marker creating red X marks

Row G shows metallic marker creating cursive text reading 'thank you very much'
Row H shows archival writing pen creating thin line work

Color-coded applicability chart with rows for pen types A-H and columns for application surfaces: Cards, Scrapbooks, Paper Crafts, Photos, Labels, Metal, Plastic, Wood, Cardboard

book_promotion.title: Martha Stewart's Encyclopedia of Crafts
book_promotion.description: Organized by topic from A to Z and filled with projects, templates, and detailed instructions for craft techniques, it is the ultimate resource for devoted crafters and weekend crafters alike
